earth alſo moſt faithfull moſt affectionate adorer ever lived aſſurance ſhall never enjoy contentment death ſooner caſt eye upon writing knew hand celadon cauſe lycidas gazing water look uſed ſuch diligence two three dayes found ſolitary habitation ſo much unlike knowable lycidas told muſt come ſo command could hardly perſwaded brother would deceive laſt letter gave ſo revive dayes cheered humbly beſeech know way keep brother alive love himſelfe imbrace poſſible acknowledgment obligation made willing ſerve laſt ſhe ſaid thus unto sweet brother let u leave word love leſſe let u think put conſolation found even greateſt misfortune mean ſhe could lay fault upon ſelf could ſhe find excuſe turn another way certainly bin abſolutely impoſſible lived ſuch load grief ſociety diana phillis admires ſhould acquainted ſo long love ſooner though task courtſhip undertaken origen diſeaſe yet made complaint becauſe diana without offence allowed liberty expreſſe paſſion ſuch violence love allowed ſome vent would broke could poſſibly lived without conſulted himſelfe plainly ſaw made diſadvantageous change eſpecially remembered happy abſolute maſter himſelfe oft muſter argument drawn reaſon rid himſelfe new ſervitude found reaſon weak would arme himſelfe violent reſolutions againſt ala look oft tryed theſe way ſo oft ſee vain man ſtrive aganſt ordinance heaven whoſo wiſe rather comply ſubmit thereunto therefore every morning night civility denyed diana company uſed retire himſelfe manner company well becauſe world without irkſome unto conſult freely himſelfe conſider way beſt take effect deſires though ſaw many impoſſibilities purſuit affection yet could fix upon reſolutions concluded advantage love time ſtarted deſigne make retreat oh ſuddenly would heart give check unto himſelfe determined purſue oh difficulty rub many martyrdom foreſee ſhall silvander would ſay himſelfe ſince purſuit retreat equally impoſſible would ſay anſwer himſelfe thy beſt way heaven would ſelfe cannot expreſſe unto greatneſſe anger perfidious impoſtor ſaid ſhe unto would ſo mortally offend one never gave occaſion durſt ſo great injury ſo impudent come ſight han prepared ſelfe chiding juſt ala cannot complain againſt againſt love inflamed ſoul towards freez towards love juſt would ſome ſort cooled ardent affection ſhould forced offend needed uſed trick drive away rivall ala ſee noviſt love ſince look reaſon thing doth fair dorinde wrong complaining againſt action ſince effect love yet ſhould expect ſquared according rule reaſon muſt confeſſe ſinned againſt rule reaſon againſt love beſeech take rationall amorous moſt extreamly wounded dart love expreſſed extremity affection ſo much dejected humility paſſionate language good melting influence upon ſoul ſo within day ſhe began ſmile upon pardon offence ſee ill chance ſometimes profitable cauſe anger augmented good unto conſidering artifice uſed ſhe opinion moſt certainly love conſideration cauſed thcombres miſſe miſtreſſe ſhe devoted ſelfe wholly unto ſo may ſeem love make hate yet loved florice much dorinde truth dorindes favour flow uſuall upon begin love nothing doth kindle affection augment ſo much favour living thus ambodexterouſly florice dorinde florice began enter ſome ſuſpition common brute affection blown therefore one day ſhe ſpoke unto ſhe quite altered really love vow ſwear courtſhip dorinde effect command cover thereby affection unto ſhe would would never look upon dorinde told ſhe would look ſelfe glaſſe look upon dorinde ſight would give better aſſurance ſervice affection word could child fairer leriana ſo well inſtructed asked ſhe went away without telling ſhe anſwered ſhe durſt knock dore fear diſturbance ſhe went ſhe thought ſhe ſhould ſtayed away two three day moſt ſo thought witneſſes though yet ſince truth ſide ſome maintain armes againſt whoſoever ſhall maintain contrary know madam ſuch thing dubious cannot made apparent convincing proofes truth tryed armes leontidas perſon honour began angry craft conceived uſed ſaid certain ſhe fault ſhall ſelfe accuſe maintain againſt men whomſoever leriana made ſelfe ſure two coſengermans deſired ſeem affectionate unto leontidas ſhe turned towards wife madam ſaid ſhe unto rather die lord ſhould enter armes upon occaſion beſeech divert elſe proteſt meddle matter leotaris couſen german brother undertake charge indeed country ſee friend kindred carried away captive ſtrange country oh ſad fatall marriage unto much better firſt day towne taken laſt life upon wiſe prudent princeſſe fell tear foot ataulfus kiſſed ſo conſtantius returne gave aquitaine unto ſaid vulius lived quietly good coreſpondency roman great conſtantius got better almanes killed king called acatius afterwards vanquiſhed swede doubtleſſe vandal driven revolt attalus cauſed rome intending declare himſelfe emperor becauſe honorius child named ſucceſſor conſtantius leaving enterpriſe spaine unperfect came rome ſeizing upon rebell confined himſelfe unto hippodrome honorius ſo well pleaſed made aſſociate declared auguſtus fortune commonly ſeconds one favour another ſo conſtantius behold conquerer spaine tryumphant rome aſſociate empire thought ſhe puniſh caſtinus ſhe ſhould extreamly offend aetius reaſon amity betwixt therefore keeping caſtinus ſafetie ſhe conceived would keep unto duty almoſt forcing unto ſave life friend jealouſie honorius procured valentinian ſend generall gaul againſt ſeverall nation poſſeſſed went proof fidelity tranſacted ſo hunnes gepides ſet foot italy returned back went pannonia ſoon came gaul emperour however mahortius defeated boniface valentinian ſent siſulphus thither whoſe picture may ſee next valentinian deſirous well valour prudence conſtant fidelity unto maſter conceiving excellent quality rendred worthy placed amongſt ſo many illuſtrious perſons siſulphus firſt ſeized upon carthage forced boniface fly mauritania finding ſafety himſelfe called genſerick king vandalls betique vandal glad come spain becauſe goth thierry king room enough themſelves ſo preſſe upon vandal tormented able defend themſelves boniface offered genſerick ſhare affrica reduced unto ſuch paſſe knew way fortune variety ſeeing ſelfe unable ſupport great weight affair ſhe foreſaw would fall upon valentinian ſhe extreamly deſire ſee married long reſolved upon unto daughter nephew theodoſius ever ſame intention thing ſo managed valentinian went unto conſtantinople marriage ſolemnized great contentment theodoſius placidia theodoſius becauſe daughter empreſſe moſt deſired placidia becauſe ſhe much good company uſed many exerciſes recreation ſake intervalls ſtudies ſometimes ſhould go upon sea ſometimes play upon lute ſometimes run leap pitch bar ſome recreation keep u idleneſſe ruſt life mother vice hapned summer time five ſix u company wearied ſelves book went bathe ſelves end went towne towards liguria unto point rock ſhot ſelfe sea whence accuſtomed leap head formoſt water ſhould oft time touch bottome hand time upon rock undreſſing ſelves prevented ſudden ſtorm wind rain preſently ſeconded lightning thunder heaven grew immediately dusky colour wave began riſe ſo high hardly ſafe upon top high rock ſuch fury violence wave daſh againſt terrible ſee ſuddenly day turned night hear ſtrange roaring sea conſider chaos hideous confuſion raging element certainly bluſtering ſtorme forced u away ſome good genius ſtayed u imagine many ſhips would ſuffer much dammage becauſe winde blow towards u reſolved ſtay till ſtorme ſee fortune could helpfull unto seabeaten paſſengers ſhelter u little rain winde crept little corner rock wont hide clothes bathed ſelves ſtorme laſted two houres begun weary upon point going away sky begun cleer left raining came rock going top began look whether could diſcover thing upon sea winde wafted away cloudes sun began ſhine yet wave ceuſed becauſe winde continued ſtill great high time diſcourſing amongſt ſelves upon boldneſſe marriners eſpecially firſt adventured sea terrible enraged sea wiſe man would never truſt himſelfe one company obſervant sea diſcourſe hold ſaid methinks ſee ſhip upon aroſe ſee whether ſaid true firſt none himſelfe could ſee thing preſently ſomething might diſcerned winde ſo high wafted theſe ſhips preſently neerer u every one plainly diſcerned neither sailes maſt tackling ſeen ſtorm conſtrained marriners take downe nothing made uſe rudder ſcarcely able reſiſt tempeſt ſight pittifull winde ſo high could keep themſelves juſtling one againſt cry thoſe within winde wafted unto u lamentable hear deck upon knee holding hand heaven moſt ſeeing ſhore undreſt hoping ſhip came neerer ſave themſelves ſwimming fortune boyſterous wave daſhed againſt rock great ruſh firſt gave againſt made recoil back ſuch violence meeting another followed broke great part poop prow sea ready ſwallow another wave came daſhed ſo great force againſt ſame rock ſhips quite overwhelmed oh god lamentable ſpectacle laid hold upon point rock ſtrove get footing till ſome help came others ſeized upon root grew rock ſo hung armes ſome laid hold ſuch root breaking fell sea till wave brought back ſome got upon board pole ſuch like moſt drowned moved moſt compaſſion ſee ſome woman help themſelves cry muſt confeſſe moved ſo much halfe undreſt haſted ſtrip ſelfe naked though danger great reaſon windes wave would relieve often done pleaſure leaped rock sea water ſaw two woman embracing ready ſinke took one hair ſwimming hand drew aſhore leaving halfe dead went water help two men whoſe amity moved compaſſion one could ſwim got upon back ſave load ſo heavy elſe upmoſt younger hang ſo neck friend fear drowning neither ſtrength breath left already ſunk two three time water took could ſwim one hand ſo eaſing took heart ſo got ſhore companion example like ſo ſaved many becauſe thought god commanded particular care thoſe ſaved ſhipwrack put clothes went unto aſſiſted poſſibly could gotten ſome water ſwallowed began reaſonable well eſpecially woman moſt danger thought themſelves ſo obliged u deſired know name country heard ſay thought ſelfe either seguſian foreſtian oh god ſaid one men ſuch country one deſtined recall u death asked ſaid ſo ſeeing fit time ſince ſo amazed ſhipwrack ſcarcely able breathe thing hold hand lift eye admiration miraculous eſcape becauſe almoſt naked thought fit carried town get ſome clothes cover decent carryed otherwiſe went unto town met ſo many perſons compaſſionate relieved cloth relieved life brought town quartered ſuch bourghers houſes uſed compaſſion upon men like caſe part defired thoſe two ſaved go becauſed ſeemed men merit cannot part ſaid theſe two woman ſaved becauſe committed unto charge becauſe perhaps would inconvenient ſaid unto ſo contented littleneſſe lodging would rather great ſatisfaction unto would favour foure followed becauſe friend town better lodging ſelfe carried unto houſe rich townſman familiar intimacy knowing liberality pitty ſuch would bid ſuch men ſuch condition civilly welcome ſo accommodate thing neceſſary muſt know theſe men thus ſaved two principall men rome name one urſaces olimbres ſo ſent preſently houſes furniſhed themſelves mony many ſervants ſatisfaction promiſe pleaſed know whilſt expected return rome theſe two cavalier would without ſo quitting ſtudy accompanyed unto ſuch place unto curioſity invited took much delight converſation ſweet pleaſing laſt deſiring much know unto done ſo good office one night alone chamber two woman commonly retired ſoon ſupper done entreated tell ſhould ſay heard seguſian thoſe country deſtined ſave death unto elder thus replyed hiſtory eudoxe valentinian urſaces courteous silvander ſaid one heard ſo called deſire moſt juſt obliged give ſatisfaction reaſon world ſhould know life ſaved condition ſuch ſo much obliged deferred ſo long ſome fear known might receive ſome diſpleaſure ſome ſecret enemy therefore intreat cloſe take notice u leſt pain countermand ſooner brought unto ariobindes aſilas heard death theodoſius infected plague dyed ſuddenly without iſſuemale diſpoſition carry ſad newes unto fair eudoxe beſought ariobindes might accompany meſſenger ſent ſeeming deſirous ſee italy returned requeſt eaſily granted unto way came naples thence rome welcomed deſirable caraſſes eudoxe ſadly reſent death father nature required dayes mourning valentinian received intelligence pulcheria siſter theodoſius married old generall called marcianus gotten elected emperour marcianus genſerick king vandalls priſoner affrica ſee eagle flie phraſed ſcourge god taken gaul firſt deſigne armes ſubjected valamer ardarick king oſtrogots gepides conſtrained joyne force compoſed erulians almains turingians marcomances ſome franck remained old ſelfe give ſome counſell age merit duty god invite take therefore good part ſhall ſay know ſeized extream ſorrowes deſigne againſt life offer god death moſt ſeverely puniſh murderer themſelves beſides kill one ſelfe argues defect courage durſt look dyſaſter face thoſe fly fear enemy ſo ſuch kill themſelves fear dyſaſter flye world want courage becauſe dare abide one fortune blowes god hath given unto man judgment prudence make election ſolid ſound reaſon becauſe man poſſeſſed paſſion neither judge chuſe aright hath given communicative ſoul end making choice one friend may ask counſell matter importance becauſe friend often intereſted friend buſineſſe god leaving man without good guide hath given judge king order decide manner doubt controverſies great creator men loving child would furniſh neceſſary live die end hath inſpired maſſilians conſtitute prudent judge ſeeming unto death injury tribute nature therefore would unjuſtly done deny remedy unto ſuch reaſon demand therefore erected publick theater city uſe keep poyſon give unto drink ſhall deſire die ſo councell ſix hundred adjudge reaſons deſires death good hint unto sir oppreſſed ſad dyſaſter may rid ſelfe tyranny judgment ſo many worthy wiſe prudent perſons part becauſe ſhall think give ſuch counſell take ſelfe reſolved within theſe day make addreſſe unto incited thereunto contrary opinion unto lived along age full foureſcore nineteen year great felicity according rank quality rich gift fortune profeſſion happy child beloved neighbour eſteemed every one lived ſo would die happily would ſtay ſo long untill hundreth year leſt ſhould tempt ſome dyſaſter make die miſerable learned priamas dyed little loſſe town greateſt prince aſia good old man uſed language unto ſmall operation upon thought ſoon came infinitely compaſſionate fortune eudoxes anſwered ſeen many petitioned counſell six hundred poyſon granted unto ſome refuſed unto others deſired favour keep ſecret leſt ſome friend unto maximus ſhould
